comments:
Actually org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.draw2d.ui.internal.graphics.ScaledGraphics wrap Graphics, but not delegate setClip(Path path) to it.
And scaledGraphics.setClip(path) throws 

java.lang.RuntimeException: The class: class org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.draw2d.ui.render.internal.graphics.RenderedMapModeGraphics has not implemented this new graphics function
at org.eclipse.draw2d.Graphics.subclassFunctionMission(Graphics.java:897)
at org.eclipse.draw2d.Graphics.setClip(Graphics.java:767)
Original ScaledGraphics in Draw2D does not support clip path scaling; I think that this request is more general and ScaledGraphics in GMF should follow Draw2D fix.
I've also submitted request https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=191976 to remove duplicate ScaledGraphics class from GMF runtime.

traces.message: The class: class org.eclipse.gmf.runtime.draw2d.ui.render.internal.graphics.RenderedMapModeGraphics has not implemented this new graphics function
